text: Xylosma congestum, commonly known as shiny xylosma, is a species of flowering plant native to China. ==Discovery== The species was first recorded in China by Jesuit missionary João de Loureiro. ==Description== X. congestum can grow up to tall and wide. New leaves are a red-bronze colour that mature to a bright green. Although the species seldom flowers, small, black berries can be produced, which attract birds. ==References== Category:Xylosma Category:Taxa named by Elmer Drew Merrill
title: Xylosma congestum
